channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Spectral Efficiency Analysis of Uplink-Downlink Decoupled Access in C-V2X Networks
item.description: The uplink (UL)/downlink (DL) decoupled access has been emerging as a novel access architecture to improve the performance gains in cellular networks.

item.title: PointCaM: Cut-and-Mix for Open-Set Point Cloud Analysis
item.description: Specifically, we use the Unknown-Point Simulator to simulate unknown data in the training stage by manipulating the geometric context of partial known data.

item.title: Exploring Stroke-Level Modifications for Scene Text Editing
item.description: Moreover, two new datasets (Tamper-Syn2k and Tamper-Scene) are proposed to fill the blank of public evaluation datasets.

item.title: Observational and Interventional Causal Learning for Regret-Minimizing Control
item.description: A state-of-the-art observational causal discovery algorithm for time series capable of handling latent confounders and contemporaneous effects, called LPCMCI, is extended to profit from casual constraints found through randomized control trials.

item.title: TD3 with Reverse KL Regularizer for Offline Reinforcement Learning from Mixed Datasets
item.description: There are two challenges for this setting: 1) The optimal trade-off between optimizing the RL signal and the behavior cloning (BC) signal changes on different states due to the variation of the action coverage induced by different behavior policies.

item.title: Query Your Model with Definitions in FrameNet: An Effective Method for Frame Semantic Role Labeling
item.description: Such methods usually model role classification as naive multi-class classification and treat arguments individually, which neglects label semantics and interactions between arguments and thus hindering performance and generalization of models.

item.title: Federated Neural Topic Models
item.description: Over the last years, topic modeling has emerged as a powerful technique for organizing and summarizing big collections of documents or searching for particular patterns in them.

item.title: Learning Imbalanced Data with Vision Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we systematically investigate the ViTs' performance in LTR and propose LiVT to train ViTs from scratch only with LT data.

item.title: Decoding natural image stimuli from fMRI data with a surface-based convolutional network
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel approach for this task, which we call Cortex2Image, to decode visual stimuli with high semantic fidelity and rich fine-grained detail.

item.title: An iterative unbiased geometric approach to identifying crystalline order and disorder via denoising score function model
item.description: In atomistic simulations of solids, ability to classify crystal phases and lattice defects in the presence of thermal fluctuations is essential for gaining deeper insights into the simulated dynamics.

item.title: L2SR: Learning to Sample and Reconstruct for Accelerated MRI
item.description: Accelerated MRI aims to find a pair of samplers and reconstructors to reduce acquisition time while maintaining the reconstruction quality.

item.title: Images Speak in Images: A Generalist Painter for In-Context Visual Learning
item.description: In this work, we present Painter, a generalist model which addresses these obstacles with an "image"-centric solution, that is, to redefine the output of core vision tasks as images, and specify task prompts as also images.

item.title: Dissimilar Nodes Improve Graph Active Learning
item.description: The existing Active Graph Embedding framework proposes to use centrality score, density score, and entropy score to evaluate the value of unlabeled nodes, and it has been shown to be capable of bringing some improvement to the node classification tasks of Graph Convolutional Networks.

item.title: SASFormer: Transformers for Sparsely Annotated Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this work, we propose a simple yet effective sparse annotated semantic segmentation framework based on segformer, dubbed SASFormer, that achieves remarkable performance.

item.title: Impact of Domain-Adapted Multilingual Neural Machine Translation in the Medical Domain
item.description: Multilingual Neural Machine Translation (MNMT) models leverage many language pairs during training to improve translation quality for low-resource languages by transferring knowledge from high-resource languages.

item.title: Hierarchical Contrast for Unsupervised Skeleton-based Action Representation Learning
item.description: This paper targets unsupervised skeleton-based action representation learning and proposes a new Hierarchical Contrast (HiCo) framework.

item.title: FaceQAN: Face Image Quality Assessment Through Adversarial Noise Exploration
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach to face image quality assessment, called FaceQAN, that is based on adversarial examples and relies on the analysis of adversarial noise which can be calculated with any FR model learned by using some form of gradient descent.

item.title: Location-Aware Self-Supervised Transformers
item.description: In this work, we propose to pretrain networks for semantic segmentation by predicting the relative location of image parts.

item.title: MapInWild: A Remote Sensing Dataset to Address the Question What Makes Nature Wild
item.description: Antrophonegic pressure (i. e. human influence) on the environment is one of the largest causes of the loss of biological diversity.

item.title: Certifying Fairness of Probabilistic Circuits
item.description: In this paper, we propose an algorithm to search for discrimination patterns in a general class of probabilistic models, namely probabilistic circuits.

item.title: Momentum Decoding: Open-ended Text Generation As Graph Exploration
item.description: In this study, we formulate open-ended text generation from a new perspective, i. e., we view it as an exploration process within a directed graph.

item.title: Solving the Weather4cast Challenge via Visual Transformers for 3D Images
item.description: Accurately forecasting the weather is an important task, as many real-world processes and decisions depend on future meteorological conditions.

item.title: Med-Query: Steerable Parsing of 9-DoF Medical Anatomies with Query Embedding
item.description: For rib parsing, CT scans have been annotated at the rib instance-level for quantitative evaluation, similarly for spine vertebrae and abdominal organs.

item.title: LE-UDA: Label-efficient unsupervised domain adaptation for medical image segmentation
item.description: To assess the effectiveness of our method, we conduct extensive experiments on two different tasks for cross-modality segmentation between MRI and CT images.

item.title: Window Normalization: Enhancing Point Cloud Understanding by Unifying Inconsistent Point Densities
item.description: Existing methods are limited by the inconsistent point densities of different parts in the point cloud.

item.title: Deep Learning Architectures for FSCV, a Comparison
item.description: We examined multiple deep neural network (DNN) architectures for suitability in predicting neurotransmitter concentrations from labeled in vitro fast scan cyclic voltammetry (FSCV) data collected on carbon fiber electrodes.

item.title: Retrieval as Attention: End-to-end Learning of Retrieval and Reading within a Single Transformer
item.description: Systems for knowledge-intensive tasks such as open-domain question answering (QA) usually consist of two stages: efficient retrieval of relevant documents from a large corpus and detailed reading of the selected documents to generate answers.

item.title: GNN-SL: Sequence Labeling Based on Nearest Examples via GNN
item.description: To better handle long-tail cases in the sequence labeling (SL) task, in this work, we introduce graph neural networks sequence labeling (GNN-SL), which augments the vanilla SL model output with similar tagging examples retrieved from the whole training set.

item.title: RLogist: Fast Observation Strategy on Whole-slide Images with Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Most of the existing methods rely on a multiple instance learning framework that requires densely sampling local patches at high magnification.

item.title: Pair-Based Joint Encoding with Relational Graph Convolutional Networks for Emotion-Cause Pair Extraction
item.description: Emotion-cause pair extraction (ECPE) aims to extract emotion clauses and corresponding cause clauses, which have recently received growing attention.

item.title: Context-aware multi-head self-attentional neural network model for next location prediction
item.description: Accurate activity location prediction is a crucial component of many mobility applications and is particularly required to develop personalized, sustainable transportation systems.

item.title: Brain Tumor Synthetic Data Generation with Adaptive StyleGANs
item.description: Furthermore, the model can generate high-quality synthetic brain MRI with a tumor that can limit the small sample size issues.

item.title: Fast and Lightweight Scene Regressor for Camera Relocalization
item.description: The proposed approach uses sparse descriptors to regress the scene coordinates, instead of a dense RGB image.

item.title: Melody transcription via generative pre-training
item.description: The combination of generative pre-training and a new dataset for this task results in $77$% stronger performance on melody transcription relative to the strongest available baseline.

item.title: Joint graph learning from Gaussian observations in the presence of hidden nodes
item.description: Motivated by this, we propose a joint graph learning method that takes into account the presence of hidden (latent) variables.

item.title: Constructing Highly Inductive Contexts for Dialogue Safety through Controllable Reverse Generation
item.description: In order to detect such toxic generations, existing methods rely on templates, real-world data extraction, crowdsourcing workers, or automatic generation to construct adversarial contexts that are likely to induce toxic generations.

item.title: GraphGDP: Generative Diffusion Processes for Permutation Invariant Graph Generation
item.description: Graph generative models have broad applications in biology, chemistry and social science.

item.title: Automata Learning meets Shielding
item.description: Iteratively, we use the collected data to learn new MDPs with higher accuracy, resulting in turn in shields able to prevent more safety violations.

item.title: Label Encoding for Regression Networks
item.description: Prior work has shown that solving a regression problem with a set of binary classifiers can improve accuracy by utilizing well-studied binary classification algorithms.

item.title: Cross-lingual Similarity of Multilingual Representations Revisited
item.description: Related works used indexes like CKA and variants of CCA to measure the similarity of cross-lingual representations in multilingual language models.

item.title: iEnhancer-ELM: Improve Enhancer Identification by Extracting Multi-scale Contextual Information based on Enhancer Language Models
item.description: Results: In this paper, we propose a multi-scale enhancer identification method (iEnhancer-ELM) based on enhancer language models, which treat enhancer sequences as natural language sentences that are composed of k-mer nucleotides.

item.title: Exploring Stochastic Autoregressive Image Modeling for Visual Representation
item.description: By introducing stochastic prediction and the parallel encoder-decoder, SAIM significantly improve the performance of autoregressive image modeling.

item.title: Calibration and generalizability of probabilistic models on low-data chemical datasets with DIONYSUS
item.description: Deep learning models that leverage large datasets are often the state of the art for modelling molecular properties.

item.title: Laplacian Convolutional Representation for Traffic Time Series Imputation
item.description: To make an accurate reconstruction on partially observed traffic data, we assert the importance of characterizing both global and local trends in traffic time series.

item.title: Approximate Message Passing for Multi-Layer Estimation in Rotationally Invariant Models
item.description: We consider the problem of reconstructing the signal and the hidden variables from observations coming from a multi-layer network with rotationally invariant weight matrices.

item.title: CoTMix: Contrastive Domain Adaptation for Time-Series via Temporal Mixup
item.description: Specifically, we propose a novel temporal mixup strategy to generate two intermediate augmented views for the source and target domains.

item.title: AI-driven Mobile Apps: an Explorative Study
item.description: In this paper, we conduct the most extensive empirical study on 56, 682 published AI apps from three perspectives: dataset characteristics, development issues, and user feedback and privacy.

item.title: Visual Question Answering From Another Perspective: CLEVR Mental Rotation Tests
item.description: Different types of mental rotation tests have been used extensively in psychology to understand human visual reasoning and perception.

item.title: A Generalized Scalarization Method for Evolutionary Multi-objective Optimization
item.description: We analyze how GR can no longer avoid mismatches when $L_{\infty}$ is replaced by another $L_{p}$ with $p\in [1,\infty)$, and find that the $L_p$-based ($1\leq p<\infty$) subproblems having inconsistently large preference regions.

item.title: Euler Characteristic Curves and Profiles: a stable shape invariant for big data problems
item.description: While being a weaker invariant in one dimension, we show that Euler Characteristic based approaches do not possess some handicaps of persistent homology; we show efficient algorithms to compute them in a distributed way, their generalization to multifiltrations and practical applicability for big data problems.
